intro: Banksia sceptrum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved banksia, is a flowering plant native to southwestern Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense, cylindrical inflorescences. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are clustered in a cylindrical shape, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it is adapted to thrive in sandy soils. Banksia sceptrum plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
